tr.td: After exclusion of subjects with lacking or noisy fMRI sequences
After exclusion of subjects with lacking fitness data

table-wrap-foot.p: Important sample characteristics of the whole sample are listed. All numbers relate to the study sample after exclusion of screening failures. Screening failures reflect cases that were removed due to inclusion and exclusion criteria. Data from other sub-samples are neglected because they are fairly similar

Primary, secondary and tertiary visual cortices

table-wrap-foot.p: The 18 ICNs based on Laird et al. [12] including the anatomical regions that they cover are listed

1ICN01Limbic and medial-temporal areas

table-wrap-foot.p: Summary of the results of the mediation analyses. IV = independent variable, DV = dependent variable, Eff. = type of the effect, estimate = β-coefficient of the mediation effect, CI = confidence interval, n = sample size, ACME = average causal mediation effect, CENTRAL–LIM = functional connections between seeds from central cortical structures and limbic lobe, CEREB–CEREB = functional connections between cerebellar seeds, CEREB–NUC = functional connections between cerebellar seeds and seeds from the subcortical nuclei, OCC–TEMP = functional connections between seeds from the occipital lobe and temporal lobe, TEMP–TEMP = functional connections between seeds from the temporal lobe
